meanings.definition: A race or bicycle race held on a short course closed to traffic.
meanings.sent1: The local criteriums brought excitement to the town.
meanings.sent2: She trained hard for the criteriums to improve her speed.
meanings.sent3: The criteriums turned the quiet streets into a thrilling race track.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cycling, criteriums are like fast-paced chess games on wheels.
meanings.sent5: The criteriums were a blur of colorful jerseys and spinning wheels.

meanings.definition: A set of standards or criteria used to make a judgment or decision.
meanings.sent1: The company's criteriums for hiring focused on experience and attitude.
meanings.sent2: She carefully considered the criteriums before choosing the best option.
meanings.sent3: The criteriums for picking a movie were simple: comedy and under two hours.
meanings.sent4: His moral criteriums guided him to always do the right thing.
meanings.sent5: Following the criteriums ensured a fair evaluation of the project.
